https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/wGkGBBL2KORrz5U2UFFMUM5CPto.jpg A land and sea-scape film drawn from rich sources of imagery: the constantly changing mood of the sea to the distinctly different shorelines of Kent and the Pas de Calais – twenty-one miles of water that define both the “island race” and English hostility towards a wider integration within Europe. Continental Drift
